name: No Issues Here
description:
WARNING:

This game is an intentional, direct representation of inaccessibility in gaming, with a specific focus on sensory processing difficulties. At it's current point in development, the auditory elements haven't been fully added, but the visual elements are definitely at a point where they can be problematic for anyone who struggles with visual processing issues or sensory overload.

One of the developers can't play much without getting a headache. Additionally, at the later stage there are flashing lights! This may be a risk for photo-sensitive people. Please play with caution!

No Issues Here!
Art and character by Brianna Essery
Music, programming, and that one eyeball by Mikhael O'Brien
[See devlog for current status and known issues]

Playable in Windows
